titlestmt.titleproper: Preliminary Inventory to the Richard W. Franke Files on Indonesia and East Timor TAM 590
titlestmt.author: Finding aid prepared by Rachel Ann Schimke and Daniel Michelson, Sep 2011

profiledesc.creation: This finding aid was produced using the Archivists' Toolkit 2011-10-03T10:24-0400

did.unittitle: Richard W. Franke Files on Indonesia and East Timor

separatedmaterial.head: Separated Materials
separatedmaterial.p: Approximately one hundred issues of the Tapol Bulletin (UK), Tapol Bulletin (US), Southeast Asian Chronicle, Indonesia: feiten en meningen, and the East Timor Estafeta were separated for cataloging, as were a couple dozen books.

bioghist.head: Historical/Biographical Note
bioghist.p: Richard W. Franke served as a professor of anthropology at the Montclair State University from 1972 to 2009. He edited the U.S. Tapol Bulletin, the official publication of Tapol USA, from 1975 until 1980. The UK-based Tapol was initially formed in 1973 as an advocacy organization to support political prisoners in Indonesia. Their mission later expanded to encompass general human rights concerns in Indonesia and East Timor. The now defunct U.S. branch of Tapol was located in Montclair, New Jersey. Franke also wrote extensively on East Timor and Indonesia for many publications, including the Guardian and the Bulletin of Concerned Asian Scholars.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Content Note
scopecontent.p: The collection contains files related to political and human rights in Indonesia and East Timor from the 1960s through the 1980s. The advocacy and other activities of Tapol and its U.S. branch makes up a significant portion of the collection. It also includes information on the work of Amnesty International and other human rights organizations.

processinfo.head: Processing Information note
processinfo.p: Inventoried by Rachel Ann Schimke and Daniel Michelson, Sep 2011. Periodicals and books were separated for cataloging. Some routine financial information discarded.

relatedmaterial.head: Related Material at the Tamiment Library/Robert F. Wagner Labor Archives
relatedmaterial.p: East Timor and Indonesia Action Network (ETAN) Records (TAM 393)

did.unittitle: Publications on Indonesian Economics, Correspondence, Statements to United Nations General Assembly, International Conference on East Timor and Indonesia, Clippings (including the Congressional Record), and UN Press Releases
East Timor and the United Nations and Timor Information Service Publications; and Correspondence, Clippings, and Academic Conference Papers on East Timor and Indonesia
Correspondence (mostly Amnesty International), Academic Conference Papers, Petitions/Advocacy for East Timor, and Publications on Indonesia
Congressional Hearings, Clippings, Publications on Human Rights in East Timor, Addresses to United Nations on East Timor, Academic Papers, and Buttons
Letters to and Testimony Before Congress on East Timor, Academic Papers, Clippings, Reports on Military Situation in East Timor, and Congressional Hearings

Permanent People's Tribunal in Lisbon (1981), Manuscript "Impasse in Java's Agriculture: A Case for Chinese Style Collectivization" by R.R. Smith, Informational Publications on Indonesia, Manuscript About 1965 Coup, East Timor Advocacy, and Academic Papers
East Timor Human Rights Advocacy Publications, Clippings, Correspondence (mostly related to Tapol US and UK), and Statements before the United Nations on East Timor and Indonesia
Clippings, Photographs, Academic Papers, Permanent People's Tribunal in Lisbon, Prisons in Indonesia, East Timor Famine, Papers by Noam Chomsky, and Information on West Irian
Film "Isle of Fear, Isle of Hope," Two Posters, and Bumper Stickers
